data_facts_with_para.paragraph: How do you fix one of the best-sellingelectric carsin the UK? That was the task for Tesla who have consistently seen the Model 3 and the Model Y in the top three sold EVs in the country. The answer is this; an updated Model 3 that’s been improved and aggressively repriced: it now costs £39,990 for the entry level rear-wheel drive trim.

facts.fact_content: The entry level rear-wheel drive trim of the updated Model 3 costs £39,990.

data_facts_with_para.paragraph: That new styling also results in improved efficiency:�a0The drag coefficient is now 0.219 – and with no changes to the batteries and motors, range has improved to up to 421 miles. Wind noise is also reduced by 30% according to Tesla. Other refinement-improvement changes include double-glazed acoustic glass, improved suspension bushes, seals and sound-dampening materials.

facts.fact_content: The drag coefficient of the updated Model 3 is 0.219.
The range of the updated Model 3 has improved to up to 421 miles.
Wind noise is reduced by 30% according to Tesla.

data_facts_with_para.paragraph: The entry-level model gets a 323-mile range, 125mph top speed and a 5.8 second 0-60mph sprint time. The Long-Range model increases that to 436-miles, with the same top speed and a quicker sprint time of 4.9 seconds. Finally, the Long Range all-wheel-drive model has a slightly reduced range of 390-miles but it’s the fastest non-Performance model with a 0-60mph time of 4.2 seconds. Top speed is the same.

facts.fact_content: The entry-level model gets a 323-mile range.
The entry-level model has a 125mph top speed.
The entry-level model has a 5.8 second 0-60mph sprint time.
The Long-Range model has a 436-mile range.
The Long-Range model has a 4.9 second 0-60mph sprint time.
The Long Range all-wheel-drive model has a 390-mile range.
The Long Range all-wheel-drive model has a 4.2 second 0-60mph sprint time.

data_facts_with_para.paragraph: The rear-wheel drive model uses a 57.5kWh battery, while the rest of the range use a larger 79kWh battery. Any advancements Highland gets in range from the last model are down to aero efficiency improvements.

facts.fact_content: The rear-wheel drive model uses a 57.5kWh battery.
The rest of the range uses a 79kWh battery.

data_facts_with_para.paragraph: As for charging? Tesla quotes 175 miles in 15 minutes for all models in this review.

facts.fact_content: Tesla quotes 175 miles in 15 minutes for all models in this review.
